019
020import net.tnemc.core.currency.Currency;
021import net.tnemc.core.currency.parser.impl.FractionParseRule;
022import net.tnemc.core.currency.parser.impl.NumericParseRule;
023import net.tnemc.core.currency.parser.impl.RandomParseRule;
024import net.tnemc.core.currency.parser.impl.RomanParseRule;
025import net.tnemc.core.currency.parser.impl.ShortenParseRule;
026import net.tnemc.core.currency.parser.impl.SymbolParseRule;
027
028import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
029
030/**
031 * MoneyParser
032 *
033 * @author creatorfromhell
034 * @since 0.1.4.0
035 */
036public class MoneyParser {
037
038  private final LinkedHashMap<String, ParseRule> rules = new LinkedHashMap<>();
039
040  public MoneyParser() {
041
042    addRule(new RomanParseRule()); // X, IV - works without symbol attached
043    rules.put("roman2", new RomanParseRule());
044    addRule(new FractionParseRule()); // 1/2 -> .50 - doesn't work
045    addRule(new RandomParseRule()); // random(1-10) = 6?
046    addRule(new SymbolParseRule()); //$5 -> sets currency to USD
047    addRule(new NumericParseRule()); // scientific notation and general numerics
048    addRule(new ShortenParseRule()); // 5k -> 5000
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * Adds a rule to the MoneyParser object.
053   *
054   * @param rule The ParseRule object to add to the rules collection.
055   */
056  public void addRule(final ParseRule rule) {
057
058    rules.put(rule.identifier(), rule);
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Parses the input string based on the specified rules for the given region.
063   *
064   * @param region The region to parse the input for.
065   * @param input  The input string to be parsed.
066   *
067   * @return A ParseMoney object containing the parsed information.
068   */
069  public ParseMoney parse(final String region, final String input) {
070
071    final ParseMoney parseMoney = new ParseMoney(region);
072
073    String parsedInput = input;
074    for(final ParseRule rule : rules.values()) {
075      parsedInput = rule.apply(parseMoney, parsedInput);
076    }
077
078    return parseMoney;
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Parses the input string based on the specified rules for the given region.
083   *
084   * @param region The region to parse the input for.
085   * @param input  The input string to be parsed.
086   *
087   * @return A ParseMoney object containing the parsed information.
088   */
089  public ParseMoney parse(final String region, final Currency currency, final String input) {
090
091    final ParseMoney parseMoney = new ParseMoney(region, currency);
092
093    String parsedInput = input;
094    for(final ParseRule rule : rules.values()) {
095      parsedInput = rule.apply(parseMoney, parsedInput);
096    }
097
098    return parseMoney;
099  }
100}
